an4.79:4.1: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to the Buddha,
an4.79:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an4.79:4.4: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why for different people the same kind of business undertaking might fail,
an4.79:5.1: “Sāriputta, take a case where someone goes to an ascetic or brahmin and invites them
an4.79:5.2: to ask for what they need.
an4.79:5.3: But they fail to give what’s requested.
an4.79:5.4: When they’ve passed away from that life, if they’re reborn in this world, whatever business they undertake fails.
an4.79:6.1: Take a case where someone goes to an ascetic or brahmin and invites them
an4.79:6.2: to ask for what they need.
an4.79:6.3: They give what’s requested, but don’t meet expectations.
an4.79:6.4: When they’ve passed away from that life, if they’re reborn in this world, whatever business they undertake doesn’t meet expectations.
an4.79:7.1: Take a case where someone goes to an ascetic or brahmin and invites them
an4.79:7.2: to ask for what they need.
an4.79:7.3: They give what’s requested, meeting expectations.
an4.79:7.4: When they’ve passed away from that life, if they’re reborn in this world, whatever business they undertake meets expectations.
an4.79:8.1: “Sāriputta, take a case where someone goes to an ascetic or brahmin and invites them
an4.79:8.2: to ask for what they need.
an4.79:8.3: They give what’s requested, exceeding expectations.
an4.79:8.4: When they’ve passed away from that life, if they’re reborn in this world, whatever business they undertake exceeds expectations.
an4.79:9.1: This is the cause, this is the reason why for different people the same kind of business enterprise might fail,
